intro: Cayratia fugongensis, commonly known as the Guangxi cayratia, is a climbing vine native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruits are dry, dehiscent capsules that release tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
